System API
[System Call API]

System Call API manages all system calls from usermode to halOS (supervisormode). More...


Data Structures

struct  Process

Typedefs

typedef struct processInfoBlock process_info_block_t
 Used for top() comand, presents current process information in a new datastructure.
typedef struct processPtrBlock processPtrBlock_t
 Used for the Ressource Manager in the halOS kernel for determining the foreground/background process and for switching trough all processes (task switch through user), ATTENTION: this should only accessed for reading, otherwise the scheduler will get in troubles.

void get_running_processes (process_info_block_t *ret_parm)

Detailed Description

System Call API manages all system calls from usermode to halOS (supervisormode).

...

giaco, momo

Function Documentation

uint64_t get_kernel_time (  ) 

Gets the current system kernel time of halOS

Returns:
kernel time

int8_t get_nr_of_running_processes (  ) 

Gets the number of running processes, this is often used by the top() comand to determine the size of memory which have to be allocated

Returns:
number of all processes in the system (including the running and idle process)

void get_running_processes ( process_info_block_t *  ret_parm  ) 

Gets information about the current running process, info: running process can change very quickly because the scheduler switches the tasks very often (depending on TIMESLICE and available possible RUNNABLE processes)

Parameters:
ret_parm 

int32_t kill_process ( char *  pidName  ) 

Kills and deletes a process

Parameters:
processName the process to kill

void start_process ( char *  processName  ) 

System call for starting a process by the process name,

See also:
BinImages[] in pcb.c for available processes/applications to start
Parameters:
processName name of the process to start

void *  ret_param 
)

System call without any parameter

Parameters:
scall_number specifys the number of the systemcall, see also hsystem_call_table in hsystem_call_table.h
ret_param can be used as void pointer for everthing or as return parameter

int32_t  param1,

)
